page.title: 14THE BRIGHTON BY_PASS (1)
page.content: If the Brighton by-pass is to be built ,it would start at Shoreham,and end at Falmer,Brighton.If it is built,it will ruin the South downs,an area of historical interest and great beauty, beauty which people come from all over Britain to see.Also,if it is built, 70ft slopes will be left,trees will be lost and animals will be killed;a great disaster towards nature.The Hangleton link,which wil link up the by-pass to the A27 would cut straight through the Hove Golf Club,another place of great beauty,of historical interest and a place of leisure to many.There would be a jumction in the middle of Stanmer Woods,which would endanger the lives of pupils of Falmer School,as there would be more traffic to look out for while crossing the road to get to school.
